description: ## Overview Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer due to improper allocation of space for device buttons in `DeviceFocusEvent` and `ProcXIQueryPointer`. An attacker can achieve arbitrary code execution or cause a denial of service by sending crafted input that maps buttons to a value higher than the allocated space, leading to a heap overflow. ## Remediation Upgrade `xorg-server` to version 21.1.11, 23.2.4 or higher. ## References - [Gitlab Commit](https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/xorg/xserver/-/commit/4e78bc3a6e593f70aa5306b314edbec03d2f9081) - [Gitlab Commit](https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/xorg/xserver/-/commit/b5cb27032d3e486ba84a491e1420e85171c4c0a3) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2257691) - [RedHat CVE Database](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2023-6816)
remediation: Upgrade xorg-server to version 21.1.11, 23.2.4 or higher.
title: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
